How to Cover Your Tracks with Chimichurri | Bon Appétit

It gets better: If you sign up for our newsletter, you'll get this letter before everyone else.Ch-ch-ch-chimichurriSo much better than a Chia Pet. We had an “analytics” meeting this week and discovered that one of the most popular recipes on the site that readers find through Google is this classic chimichurri sauce. I have big plans to make it this weekend to accompany all of these steaks my great aunt froze that are currently thawing just for me. Family! We’re going to grill them and douse in this parsley-packed chimichurri because I have no idea how long they’ve been in that freezer.Want this letter before it hits the website? Sign up for our newsletter!Photo by Peden + MunkTime’s running OUT!This is the time of late summer we all feel a sudden urge to cook like crazy. Produce comes and goes so fast you wonder if you really ate enough rhubarb (you didn’t). This roundup of the staff’s summer bucket list recipes got me extra intrigued about these grilled clams—cooked in a cast iron on the grill with a brothy tomato sauce to dip (grilled) bread in. See the whole bucket list here.Speaking of overripe produce on your counterDid you see this launch this week?Via PaneraWhat is this?Panera announced a Double Bread Bowl option for Philly locations and it makes me want to punch my fists into the warm soup and wear it as a muff.A must-read interviewWith cookbook author Virginia Willis:“I don’t want people to look at the news and see those angry faces and Dixie flags in Charlottesville, Virginia and think everyone in the south is like that. I know this is a cookbook, but this cookbook is the way I can express that.”Claire’s biggest successRecreating Oreos—to a T. She did it! The journey is something to behold. Watching Claire succeed fills my heart with warmth and joy, or maybe that’s all the Oreos in my arteries. There’s a cameo in the episode of our beloved mail manager, Gary, who has to deliver packages of dairy-free cashewgurt and other bulky press mail day-in and day-out and yet he’s never not smiling. Gary tried to avoid the camera, but they came right toward him. “It tasted just like the real thing,” he told me. Watch it here.SURPRISE MAILThen Gary had a surprise package for me. A secret admirer sent me a bulk box of 36 Cow Tales, my favorite candy ever. They’re long, soft caramel tails with a cream filling that dissolves in your mouth as you chew chew chew like a cow in deep thought. This is the BEST DAY OF MY LIFE.What’s up, unnecessary food feud of the weekChicken butts. An unnamed staffer confessed that she hard-boiled some eggs in the same pot she was making lentils. “Is that okay?” She asked. “Or is it gross because the egg...came out of the chicken’s....” Cloaca. That’s the hole the egg (and everything else, sorry to inform you) comes out of. And sure, it might land in some coop poop but I’m sure it’s cleaned off by the time it gets to your kitchen, plus just rinse it?! Everyone agreed that multitasking boiling eggs while cooking other things is fine. It’s FINE. We didn’t really feud over this so much as spend 11 minutes talking about chicken butts.
